title: Push-to-talk no longer functions correctly

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

### OBS Studio Version

27.0.0

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/6tCS6jlZTFHZFYg0

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

In OBS Studio releases prior to 27.0, I could use various hotkeys such as my Right Control or Mouse 6 (DPI typically) for push-to-talk on the default Audio Input Capture (Pulseaudio).

### Current Behavior

In OBS Studio 27.0, I am no longer able to use push-to-talk and have had to temporarily switch to constant transmit with various filters like a limiter and noise gat.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the OBS Studio Settings window
2. Under Audio, choose Enable Push-to-talk on Audio Input Capture (Pulseaudio)
3. Under Hotkeys, type "push" to filter irrelevant items, and press a relevant key such as Right Control or a mouse button
4. Click OK to apply the settings and close the window.
5. Click off the window, press relevant key / button, and notice missing audio input in any scene which has it as a source (you may need to add it if you have a fresh configuration, I am not sure).


### Anything else we should know?

This is under X11 and Pulseaudio, as opposed to Wayland and Pipewire. Package build instructions are at https://dev.getsol.us/source/obs-studio/browse/master/package.yml, as you can see we only apply one patch from related to CMake, otherwise it is stock OBS Studio.
